urn:contentItem:697Y-FGM1-F111-G049-00000-00Sweden/Norway: Project to identify measures against extreme precipitation damage2023-09-20T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:16ZLexisNexisONLINE

SOURCE: DagensFastigheter, 20 Sep 2023, online

Sweden/Norway: Project to identify measures against extreme precipitation damageEsmerkABSTRACT

Norwegian Center for International Climate Research (Cicero), in collaboration with insurance company If and IVL Swedish Environmental Institute, is leading a new research project to identify the most economically and climately sustainable measures to prepare homes. Part of the project is to identify measures that protect against extreme precipitation damage. This can be anything from individual homeowners' efforts in the form of reverse valves and drainage, but also directed towards residential associations to develop green infrastructure that help to manage high water flows, Johan Holmqvist of IVL says.

Sweden/Norway: Project to identify measures against extreme precipitation damageEsmerkABSTRACT

Norwegian Center for International Climate Research (Cicero), in collaboration with insurance company If and IVL Swedish Environmental Institute, is leading a new research project to identify the most economically and climately sustainable measures to prepare homes. Part of the project is to identify measures that protect against extreme precipitation damage. This can be anything from individual homeowners' efforts in the form of reverse valves and drainage, but also directed towards residential associations to develop green infrastructure that help to manage high water flows, Johan Holmqvist of IVL says.

urn:contentItem:6268-MRY1-F111-G3WG-00000-00Norway: Bane Nor to use green bond loan for investments2021-03-05T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:16ZLexisNexisONLINE

SOURCE: International Railway Journal, 05 Mar 2021, online

Norway: Bane Nor to use green bond loan for investmentsEsmerkABSTRACT

Norwegian rail infrastructure company Bane Nor has successfully subscribed the NOK 1.20bn (EUR 117.08mn USD 141.92mn) green bond loan in light of a loan-to-value ratio and increasing demand for green investments. The money will be pumped into green infrastructure schemes, including new offices at the Voss railway station and a workshop at Storen.

urn:contentItem:5HYH-58F1-JDHY-S02Y-00000-00Sweden/Norway/Germany: E.ON invests in green infrastructure2016-01-27T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:16ZLexisNexisONLINE

SOURCE: Svensk Åkeritidning, 27 Jan 2016, online

Sweden/Norway/Germany: E.ON invests in green infrastructureEsmerkABSTRACT

E.ON is planning to install 70 rapid charging posts for electric cars and two LNG filling stations between Oslo in Norway, Stockholm in Sweden and Hamburg in Germany. The investment will take place over the next three years and will be in cooperation with local authorities. 50 of these charging posts and both LNG filling stations will be in Sweden. E.ON is now drawing up detailed plans for where the infrastructure will be built.

urn:contentItem:5SWB-GJM1-JDHY-S31S-00000-00Sweden: GIG secures EUR 270mn funding for 235-MW wind farm project2018-07-24T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:16ZLexisNexisONLINE

SOURCE: SteelGuru, 24 Jul 2018, online

Sweden: GIG secures EUR 270mn funding for 235-MW wind farm projectEsmerkABSTRACT

The UK-based Green Investment Group (GIG) is set to commence a 235-MW onshore wind farm project in Vasternorrland, Sweden. It successfully raised EUR 270mn (USD 316.73mn) to fund the project and already secured a 29-year power purchase agreement (PPA) with Norway-based aluminium and renewable energy company, Norsk Hydro. Credit Agricole CIB and KfW IPEX-Bank GmbH invested EUR 160mn (in the form of senior debt) in the financing. GIG, a specialist in green infrastructure investments and a subsidiary of the Australia-based Macquarie Group, has informed that the project will start immediately and will feature 56 Siemens Gamesa 4.2-MW turbines upon its completion.

urn:contentItem:5SV8-MMP1-JDHY-S4DH-00000-00Norway/Sweden: Norsk Hydro signs long lasting wind power agreement2018-07-19T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:16ZLexisNexisONLINE

SOURCE: E24 - Norway, 19 Jul 2018, online

Norway/Sweden: Norsk Hydro signs long lasting wind power agreementEsmerkABSTRACT

Norwegian aluminium company Norsk Hydro has signed an agreement with UK green infrastructure company Green Investment Group regarding provision of wind power from a wind farm set to be constructed in Sweden. The agreement has been signed for 29 years and will provide Norsk Hydro with 0.3 TWh annually between 2021 and 2031, followed by an increase to 0.55 TWh annually between 2031 and 2050. Tor-Ove Horstad, SVP and Head of Energy Commercial at Norsk Hydro, states that the agreement is the longest-lasting agreement in the world, and that this will not be the last agreement the company signs. Norsk Hydro has now entered wind power agreements totalling 4.5 TWh annually starting in 2021.
